meanings.definition: To strip (something) of its covering or surface layer.
meanings.sent1: The strong wind denudes the trees of their leaves.
meanings.sent2: The construction workers denudes the old building of its paint.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel denudes the garden of all its flowers.
meanings.sent4: Time denudes us of our youthful innocence.
meanings.sent5: The river denudes the riverbank, revealing layers of sediment.

meanings.sent1: The archaeologist carefully denudes the ancient artifact.
meanings.sent2: The artist denudes the canvas before starting a new painting.
meanings.sent3: The magician denudes the table to reveal a hidden compartment.
meanings.sent4: The storm denudes the landscape, exposing its raw beauty.
meanings.sent5: The detective denudes the truth, unraveling the mystery.
